info.name: Infrastructure
info.description:
Complete API collection for Infrastructure application including SuperAdmin signup, organization management, location management, roles & permissions management, user management, and project management.

ðŸ”§ WORKFLOW FIXES APPLIED:
- Fixed database permissions for app_user to access iam/project schemas
- Fixed project_phase constraint violation (changed 'planning' to 'pre_construction')
- Updated all date examples to use future dates
- Added JWT token validation in Sign In tests
- Verified complete signup workflow: SignUp â†’ Confirm â†’ SignIn â†’ API Access

âœ… ENHANCED JWT TOKEN SYSTEM:
1. SuperAdmin Signup: Creates Cognito user with custom:isSuperAdmin=true
2. Normal User Creation: Super admins create users via POST /users with Cognito integration
3. Email Confirmation: Triggers PostConfirmation Lambda â†’ Creates user in IAM database
4. Sign In: PreTokenGeneration Lambda â†’ Adds enriched JWT with:
   - User profile (user_id, org_id, email, names)
   - Location access (last_selected_location_id)
   - All locations & roles (base64 encoded for offline access)
   - Organization details and admin flags
5. Offline Authorization: Frontend can check permissions without API calls
6. UI Integration: Location dropdown populated from JWT, no additional API needed

ðŸš€ CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT OPTIMIZED:
- Mobile-first design for field workers
- Offline-capable role-based authorization
- Hierarchical access control (org â†’ location â†’ project)
- Password reset workflow for normal users

ðŸ“§ USER MANAGEMENT ENHANCEMENTS:
- Flexible user updates: PUT /users/{id} supports partial updates including email changes
- Email synchronization: Email updates automatically sync with AWS Cognito
- Automatic user activation: Users with 'pending' status are automatically activated on first successful login
- Single update endpoint: All user field updates (profile, email, status) use one unified API

request.description: Retrieves projects with optional location filtering. Use the location_id query parameter to filter projects by a specific location. If no location_id is provided, all projects will be returned.
